ygData.subject: RE: Shiny Brass Halbrid
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmm I rather like the fact that there isn t a guide on what price to sell items at.  I know that I have been overcharged for several items that I have bought,
ygData.messageBody:
Hmm I rather like the fact that there isn't a guide on what price to sell
items at. I know that I have been overcharged for several items that I have
bought, but I bought them anyway because I wanted them. Kind of adds to the
mystique of the game. The item may not necessarily be worth that much to
the general populace, but to me it was worth every penny. I have also
overcharged people for certain items. For instance when I was a young lad
me and my hunting partner were in Crushbone and we were trying to get a 2
handed dwarven axe off of Lord Darish (sp?) and he died doing it. Well when
we went and sold it, we overcharged for it because we went through a lot to
get it. And we sold it. :) Just my 2 coppers worth.

Kurik Nitesong
21st bard
Veeshan

_______________________________________
Robert Maze, robert@...
Hardware/Network Support, MCP
Access Associates
www.accessassociates.com




> -----Original Message-----
> From: Keith G. Spencer [mailto:kgs@...]
> Sent: Friday, August 06, 1999 3:05 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Shiny Brass Halbrid
>
>
> From: "Keith G. Spencer" <kgs@...>
>
> 100-125p
>
> The more I think about it, I think someone needs to set out a
> full out price
> scale of items for everyone to use at least as a reference. I'm
> consistantly annoyed to see people trying to oversell items
> to people who
> just don't have a feel for what an item is worth.
